application_type_full: Full planning & demolition in a conservation area
description: Construction of fourth floor to a main building; internal and external alterations; construction of attached six storey building with basement excavation to create additional 5 No. residential units (total of 15 residential units on site); and provision of associated refuse, cycle storage and associated landscaping
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): P-000 (floorspace schedule); P-001 (location and block plans); P-101 rev B (existing ground floor plans); P-102 rev B (proposed ground floor plans); P-103 rev B (existing and proposed lower G floor plans); P-104 (existing and proposed first floor plans); P-105 (existing and proposed second floor plans); P-106 rev B (existing and proposed third floor plans); P-107 rev B (existing and proposed fourth floor plans); P-108 rev A (existing and proposed fifth floor plans); P-200 (existing and proposed elevations); P-201 rev B (existing and proposed elevations); P-300 rev B (existing and proposed section AA); P-301 rev B (existing and proposed section BB); P-110 rev A (proposed refuse store)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| All external materials to be used for extending the principal building of the development shall match those of the existing building unless indicated on the approved plans or application form, with the exception of windows to the infill extension which shall be grey aluminium framed.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), London Plan(2021) policies D1, D3, D4 and HC1 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Flat 13, as indicated on the approved plans, shall be designed and constructed in accordance with Building Regulations Part M4(3)(2)(b), to be a wheelchair user home. Evidence demonstrating compliance shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to occupation of the development, and shall be retained as such for the lifetime of the development.
Reason: To ensure wheelchair units would be capable of providing adequate amenity in accordance with the London Housing SPG(2016) and the London Plan(2021) policy D5.
| The proposed rooflights hereby approved shall not project more than 150mm from the roof plane and shall be retained as such for the lifetime of the development

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), London Plan(2021) policies D3 and HC1 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| Prior to commencement of the development, a noise assessment shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of external noise levels from transport and industrial/ commercial/ cultural sources including aircraft noise (incl. reflected and re-radiated noise where appropriate).  Details shall include the sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications (laboratory tested including frames, seals and any integral ventilators, approved in accordance with BS EN ISO 10140-2:2010) and of acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and details of self-noise) to achieve internal room standards of SPG10 and noise limits specified by BS8233:2014. Details of best practicable mitigation measures to achieve these criteria also in external amenity shall be submitted.  The approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 and D6 of The London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) | Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved, a demolition method statement/ construction management plan shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing. Details shall include control measures for:-
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- delivery locations,
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays and 0800 -1300 Saturdays (except no work on public holidays),
- neighbour liaison, notifications to interested parties and
- public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (f) (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policy T7 of the London Plan(2021) and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan.

| Notwithstanding the plans hereby approved, further details about the glazing to units facing the atrium area, as well as a daylight sunlight study for units within the principal building with habitable room windows facing the atrium shall be submitted to and approved in writing prior to commencement of works on site. The approved details shall be implemented in full and retained thereafter.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of adjacent units and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7A  and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013);  London Plan(2021) policies D3 and D6.
| Flank balustrades to the terrace of Flat 17 shall have a height of at least 1.8m from floor level.

Reasons: To safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D6 the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | At least six (6) secure cycle parking spaces shall be provided on site for the new flats prior to occupation and shall be retained thereafter
Reason: To encourage sustainable transport modes in accordance with London Plan (2021) policy T5 and table 10.2

| The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage within an enclosure has been provided within the forecourt area of the property, and made available for use in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policy D6 and table 3.2 of the London Plan (2021).
